document_notes.text:
This update for slurm_20_02 fixes the following issues:


- CVE-2022-31251: Fixed security vulnerability in the test package (bsc#1201674).
- CVE-2022-29500: Fixed architectural flaw that can be exploited to allow an unprivileged user to execute arbitrary processes as root (bsc#1199278).
- CVE-2022-29501: Fixed vulnerability where an unprivileged user can send data to arbitrary unix socket as root (bsc#1199279).

Bugfixes:
- Fixed qstat error message (torque wrapper) (bsc#1186646).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: SchedMD Slurm 21.08.x through 20.11.x has Incorrect Access Control that leads to Escalation of Privileges and code execution.

notes.text: A Incorrect Default Permissions vulnerability in the packaging of the slurm testsuite of openSUSE Factory allows local attackers with control over the slurm user to escalate to root. This issue affects: openSUSE Factory slurm versions prior to 22.05.2-3.3.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
